title: Cognitive and Metacognitive Load Management Strategies in Computer-Based Mathematics Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics pedagogy and experience with computer-based learning tools
context.additional_context: Mathematics education design utilizing VR simulations in limited-technology smartphone-based environments

learning_goals: Learners can design math simulation materials by applying CLT (Cognitive Load Theory) and multimodal learning principles.
Learners can utilize checklists to diagnose cognitive load and metacognitive needs of learners in VR environments.
Learners can structure effective math learning activities even in low-spec VR environments based on smartphones.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
